raw_text:
Stars gear up for Bafta ceremony
 
 Film stars from across the globe are preparing to walk the red carpet at this year's Bafta award ceremony.
 
 The 2005 Orange British Academy Film Awards are being held at The Odeon in London's Leicester Square. A host of Hollywood stars, including Cate Blanchett, Leonardo DiCaprio, Keanu Reeves and Richard Gere, are expected to attend Saturday's ceremony. Hosted by Stephen Fry, the glittering ceremony will be broadcast on BBC One at 2010 GMT.
 
 Other actors expected to add to the glamour of the biggest night in UK film are Gael Garcia Bernal, Imelda Staunton, Diane Kruger, Christian Slater, Anjelica Huston, Helen Mirren and former James Bond star Pierce Brosnan. Hollywood blockbuster The Aviator, starring DiCaprio, leads the field with 14 nominations, including best film.
 
 It is up against Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Finding Neverland, The Motorcycle Diaries and British film Vera Drake, which has 11 nominations. British hope Imelda Staunton is one of the favourites to land the best actress award for her gritty role as a backstreet abortionist in the small-budget film. Other nominees in the best actress category include Charlize Theron for Monster, Ziyi Zhang for House of Flying Daggers and UK star Kate Winslet, who has two nods for her roles in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Finding Neverland.
 
 DiCaprio faces competition from Bernal, Jamie Foxx, Jim Carrey and Johnny Depp in the best actor category. And British actor Clive Owen is hoping to repeat his Golden Globe success with a best supporting actor award for his role in Closer. His co-star Natalie Portman is up against Blanchett, Heather Craney, Julie Cristie and Meryl Streep in the best supporting actress category. Mike Leigh is up for the best director award for Vera Drake, alongside Martin Scorsese for The Aviator, Michael Mann for Collateral, Michel Gondry for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Marc Forster for Finding Neverland.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about the 2005 BAFTA ceremony. Let me read through it again.

The main event is the Bafta ceremony being held in London at The Odeon. It's in 2005 because the BAFTA was renamed to BAFTA in 2010, so that makes sense for when it's being broadcast on BBC One in 2010 GMT.

A lot of Hollywood stars are attending including Cate Blanchett, Leonardo DiCaprio, Keanu Reeves, and Richard Gere. They're expected to be there for the ceremony.

Other actors like Gael Garcia Bernal, Imelda Staunton, Diane Kruger, Christian Slater, Anjelica Huston, Helen Mirren, Pierce Brosnan, and others are also coming in for the glamour of this big event in the UK film industry.

The BAFTA is up against other films with a lot of nominations. The best film winner is DiCaprio's "Aviator" which has 14 nominations. There are other big films too like "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind."

In the acting categories, different actors are competing. Best actor between DiCaprio and others, best actress between several people including Imelda Staunton. Each category has multiple contestants.

Mike Leigh is up for the best director award, along with Martin Scorsese and others from their films. So this summary needs to capture all that, focusing on key names, the ceremony's details, the main film being honored, and the competition among actors and directors.
</think>

The 2005 BAFTA ceremony will be held at The Odeon in London, with Hollywood stars such as Cate Blanchett, Leonardo DiCaprio, Keanu Reeves, and Richard Gere expected to attend. This is up against other films like "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind" and "Finding Neverland." The ceremony features Imelda Staunton, along with others, competing for the best film award. In the acting categories, there's competition between DiCaprio and Bernal for best actor, while Imelda Staunton is a favorite for best actress. For directors, Mike Leigh faces competition, including Martin Scorsese and Michel Gondry. The event highlights the UK film industry's success with several films nominated heavily.
tinyllama:1.1b: In anticipation of this year's Bafta award ceremony, several Hollywood stars are set to attend on Saturday night in London. The event will be hosted by Stephen Frary and broadcast on BBC One at 2010 GMT. Other actors expected to add to the glamour of the night include Aneesh Chaganty, Diae Kruger, Christian Slater, Anjelica Husson and Helen Mirren. The award categories for this year's ceremony include best film, best actress (11 nominations), best actor (9 nominations), best supporting actress (6 nominations) and best supporting actor (5 nominations). Cluele Owen is vying for a best supporting actor award in the category of best supporting actress. The night's biggest nominee, James Franco, has six nominations across four categories, with other nominees including Jessica Biel, Marisa Tomei, Jennifer Connelly, Jake Gyllenhaal, Melissa Leo and Kevin Spacey. British actor Clieve Owen is up against Natalie Portman in the best supporting actress category for his role in Close. Mike Leigh is set to receive the best director award for his work on Vera Drake. The event will be preceded by a red carpet ceremony at The Odon before the awards ceremony begins.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
The BAFTA Awards are an important event on the British film industry's calendar, with some of the biggest names in Hollywood taking part in a red-carpet ceremony that attracts millions of viewers around the world. This year's event will take place at the Odeon in London's Leicester Square on Saturday 13th March. The highlight of the night will be when some of the biggest names in cinema walk the red carpet, which is usually an exciting spectacle.

One of the actors set to shine is Leonardo DiCaprio, who is nominated for his role as a young yet talented surfer in the film "The Beach". Other notable nominees include Cate Blanchett, who has won multiple Oscars and BAFTAs for her role in the film "Iron Man", and Charlize Theron, who received an Academy Award for Best Actress in 2005 for her role in the film "The Blind Side".

In the best actor category, British actor Clive Owen is hoping to repeat his Golden Globe success with a best supporting actor award. His co-star, Natalie Portman, is up against Leonardo DiCaprio, Jim Carrey, and Johnny Depp in the best supporting actress category. Mike Leigh is nominated for the best director award for his film "Vera Drake", which also stars Julie Cristie, Meryl Streep, and Heather Craney.

Other nominated films include Martin Scorsese's "The Aviator" and Michael Mann's "Collateral". The BAFTA Awards have a long history of recognizing the best in British cinema, and this year's event promises to be an exciting one for fans of the industry.
phi:2.7b: This year's Bafta awards ceremony in London will be attended by Hollywood stars like Cate Blanchett, Leonardo DiCaprio, Keanu Reeves, and Richard Gere. The biggest night in UK film is up against other big names like The Aviator, The Motorcycle Diaries, Finding Neverland, and Vera Drake. Actors like Imelda Staunton and Kate Winslet are hoping to win best actress and best actor awards for their roles in House of Flying Daggers, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, and Finding Neverland, respectively. British director Mike Leigh is up for the best director award with his film Vera Drake.

stablelm-zephyr:3b:
Film stars from around the world are preparing for this year's BAFTA awards ceremony held at The Odeon in London's Leicester Square. A host of Hollywood celebrities, including Cate Blanchett, Leonardo DiCaprio, Keanu Reeves, and Richard Gere, are expected to attend the event. The ceremony will be hosted by Stephen Fry and broadcast on BBC One. British actors Gael Garcia Bernal, Imelda Staunton, Diane Kruger, Christian Slater, Anjelica Huston, Helen Mirren, and former James Bond star Pierce Brosnan are also expected to attend the glamorous night in UK film. 

Hollywood blockbuster "The Aviator," starring DiCaprio, leads the field with 14 nominations, including best film, competing against films like "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind," "Finding Neverland," "The Motorcycle Diaries," and British film "Vera Drake" which has 11 nominations. Imelda Staunton is a favorite to win the best actress award for her role as a backstreet abortionist in a small-budget film. Other nominees in the category include Charlize Theron for "Monster," Ziyi Zhang for "House of Flying Daggers," and UK star Kate Winslet, who has two nominations for her roles in "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind" and "Finding Neverland." 

DiCaprio faces competition from Bernal, Jamie Foxx, Jim Carrey, and Johnny Depp in the best actor category. British actor Clive Owen hopes to repeat his Golden Globe success with a best supporting actor award for his role in "Closer," competing against nominees like Blanchett, Heather Craney, Julie Cristie, and Meryl Streep. Mike Leigh is nominated for the best director award for "Vera Drake," alongside Martin Scorsese for "The Aviator," Michael Mann for "Collateral," Michel Gondry for "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind," and Marc Forster for "Finding Neverland."
